content.description: Sit start and move up the ramp and make some really cool moves and top out. The classic problem on this boulder.
content.location: On the backside of the boulder, there is a noticeable ramp with a 1/4 pad crimp at the bottom of it.

content.description: Crouch start with good right hand in the seam and left hand on a two finger bump and feet in the cave. Move up the s-shaped seam and top out.The full sit will bump this up a grade or so.
content.location: This is on the front of the boulder...the dead obvious s-shaped seam above a cave.

content.description: Stand start with good holds and so-so feet, crank up to the lip, and traverse right a few feet and top out.
content.location: This is on the back of the boulder about 10 feet left of the problem X-Factor.

content.description: Sit start on the steep wall with the knob. Move up to a good crimp then move left and get the sidepull and top out.
content.location: On the front side of the boulder, locate a good knob at about the 3 foot level. Start here.

content.description: Sit start as for the problem X-Factor. Make two moves up and then break left across the steep wall on good holds and poor feet. Top out about 6-7 feet left of the problem X-Factor using a good, flat hold at the lip.
content.location: This shares the same start as X-Factor.

content.description: This is a super fun problem! Start matched on a jug at the left side of the back of the boulder (overhung face). Make a move right onto a half moon, sloping rail. Traverse right and make move up to the top. There is an intermediate bump that helps stick the top lip.
content.location: It is located on the left side of the back of the boulder (overhung face).

content.description: Crouch start and traverse right all the way to the end.
content.location: This is about 12-14 feet left of the problem X-Factor.

content.description: This is a really good, 14 foot block set on top of a slab.
